text: Job’s Fifth Speech
Then\f + \fr 16:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Job answered and said,
“I have heard many \add things\add* like these;
all of you \add are\add* ⸤miserable comforters⸥.\f + \fr 16:2 \ft Literally “comforters of trouble” \f*
\add Is there\add* a limit to windy words?
What provokes you that you answer?
I myself\f + \fr 16:4 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun; \f* also could talk as you,
if ⸤you were in my place⸥;\f + \fr 16:4 \ft Literally “there is your soul in place of my soul” \f*
I could join against you with words,
and I could shake at you with my head.
I could\f + \fr 16:5 \ft Or “would” \f* encourage you with my mouth,
and the solace of my lips would\f + \fr 16:5 \ft Or “should” \f* ease the pain.
If I speak, my pain is not relieved;
and \add if\add* I cease, how much will leave me?
“Surely now he has worn me out;
you\f + \fr 16:7 \ft Singular \f* have devastated all my company.
Thus\f + \fr 16:8 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* you shriveled me up;\f + \fr 16:8 \ft Or “you have seized me” \f*
it became a witness.
And my leanness has risen up against me;
it testifies to my face.
His wrath has torn, and he has been hostile toward me;
he gnashed at me with his teeth.
My foe sharpens his eyes against me.
They gaped at me with their mouth;
they struck my cheeks with disgrace;
they have massed themselves together against me.
God delivers me to an evil one,
and he casts me into the hands of \add the\add* wicked.
“I was at ease, then\f + \fr 16:12 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he broke me in two,
and he seized \add me\add* by my neck;
then\f + \fr 16:12 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he shattered me
and set me up as a target for him.
His archers surround me;
he slashes open my kidneys, and he does not have compassion;
he pours out my gall on the ground.
He breached me ⸤breach upon breach⸥;\f + \fr 16:14 \ft Literally “breach upon \fq the \ft faces of breach” \f*
he rushes at me like a warrior.
“I have sewed sackcloth on my skin,
and I have inserted ⸤my pride⸥\f + \fr 16:15 \ft Literally “my horn” \f* in the dust.
My face is red because of weeping,
and deep shadows \add are\add* on my eyelids,
⸤although⸥\f + \fr 16:17 \ft Literally “upon,” or “because” \f* violence \add is\add* not on my hands,
and my prayer \add is\add* pure.
“O earth, you should not cover my blood,
and let there be no place\f + \fr 16:18 \ft Or “do not let it become a place” \f* for my cry for help.
So now look, my witness \add is\add* in the heavens,
and he \add who\add* vouches for me \add is\add* in the heights.
My friends scorn me;
my eye pours out tears to God,
and it argues\f + \fr 16:21 \ft Or “but may \fq someone \ft argue” \f* for a mortal with God,
and \add as\add* ⸤a human⸥\f + \fr 16:21 \ft Literally “a son of man” \f* for his friend.
Indeed, \add after\add* ⸤a few years⸥\f + \fr 16:22 \ft Literally “years of number” \f* have come,
then\f + \fr 16:22 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* I will go \add the\add* way \add from which\add* I will not return.
